conclusion: Use principles of refraction and total reflection in a prism to find refractive index and distance between points P and C.
Prism is a square with side length A; incident angle at point M is 60 degrees; total reflection at point N on BC side; reflected ray exits prism from point P on CD side.
Refractive index (n) is ratio of speed of light in vacuum (c) to speed of light in prism material (v); for total reflection, angle of incidence equals angle of reflection.
Angle of incidence is 60 degrees, angle of reflection is also 60 degrees, therefore refractive index (n) is equal to ratio of speed of light in vacuum (c) to speed of light in prism material (v).
Using Snell's law (n = sin(i)/sin(r)), refractive index n = sin(60°)/sin(60°) = 1.
Distance between points P and C is the side length of the square (A), therefore distance is A.
Refractive index of the prism is 1; distance between points P and C is A.
